ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Recipient of State Award as Best Institution for PWD in the year 2004. Recipient of the National award for best institution for PWD in the year 2009. Partnership with SSA UP for modal inclusive education activity. Implementation of IEDC, IEDSS scheme supported by govt. of India previously. Care giver training centre under National Trust.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Under this financial year the organization was running a day care center (for mentally challenged/ multi disabled children)/ resource center for deaf children through our own resources / parents support.

Apart from the previous years activities we implemented IE program for blind children and home based services for multi disabled children with the support of National Association for the blind. A sum of Rs. 1,00,000 was sanctioned from The national Trust for establishment of care giver cell for care giver training. Utilization certificate has already been submitted.

Apart from the previous years activities we implemented IE program for blind children and home based services for multi disabled children with the support of National Association for the blind. Reimbursement of Rs. 5,00,000 from The National Trust against 30 trainees of advanced care giver training program (for 6 months) after completion of the training, out of which Rs. 3,00,000 was paid to 30 trainees as Stipend.

On the basis of our previous experience we have become UNICEF partner for the implementation of modal inclusive school for children with disabilities in the Devipattan mandal of U.P. The project was initiated in the month of November 2018 and will be completed in the month of June 2019.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: When looking for state funds, know that your ethnicity and race do in fact matter. Many groups have been discriminated against in the past and have not had the same advantages of other groups. Thus, there may be state programs directed towards helping such groups as African Americans and Native Americans receive the funding they need to attend college.

There are a number of states that are trying to recruit certain types of professionals. Thus, you may be able to secure government grants for college if you are willing to exchange service for funding. For example, there are states that are trying to recruit the best and brightest teachers. Thus, they may be more willing to pay for students to attend college if they are willing to then commit a certain amount of time teaching in the state.
